column4: Looking at my graphics adapter and it says Unknownâ€¦anyways to find a driver for my system that will allow my second extended display to work?
how is this 2nd display attached? both displays on the same card?
It's a laptop with a VGA LCD Monitor hooked up.
oh, ok.. well you want to toy with xrandr or something similar then
generally something like xrandr --output VGA -auto or something.. I forget right now.. its 4am here.. heh see the manpage
I'm all new to Ubuntu, it's day 1 for me. I'll Google it I guess.
ah, well typically you can enable it from the monitor prefs gui
What do I do when Xandr is not a found command?
its xrandr and just typing that should show you what displays you have
typically the vga output is called VGA and can be enabled by saying xrandr --output VGA --auto
Thanks!

I'm at a loss for how to do that graphically due to ubuntu's crappy unity interface I have little interest in learning to use and it being so much different than plain gnome.. heh.. but the command line tricks are the same on any distro.. ;)
I tried the command and it says it could not find the VGA and is ignoring it.
I guess I'm at the dead end of this machine.
well thats why I said run xrandr first with no arguments, to see what the displays are called, on my netbook for example its VGA1 for some reason
typically one is called LVDS and one VGA on a notebook.. but it varies
Thanks, I think this one is coming down to a driver issue, that's why the VGA is not showing up at all in the list.
well also some notebooks are strange about that and have a fn key to enable it, sometimes it is easiest to just boot with the display connected and have it enabled that way
there may also be an issue with the driver though.. perhaps you could get further help if you check lspci to figure out what the graphics adapter is, and find out which driver X is using
The main LCD screen is cracked so I disabled it and left the CRT only option on. Ubuntu boots and it displays on the external monitor at first, but then turns off as it hits the login screen.

ah.. well that significantly changes things.. heh. I'm no X guru by any means.. but I think if you better explain the problem again using those details someone else might be of better assitance. I personally need to run across the street to the store.. its going on 5am, been up all night and need a lil something.. heh
I could figure it out, but would have to look up some things after I get back.. which will only be a few min
Thanks for the help, much appreciated.
